entries.title: Counting begins after India's mammoth election
entries.description: Will Prime Minister Narendra Modi secure a third term or could the opposition prove polls wrong?

entries.title: Israel confirms deaths of four more hostages in Gaza
entries.description: Israel's military says UK-Israeli Nadav Popplewell and three others "were killed while together in the area of Khan Younis during our operation there".

entries.title: Gaza ceasefire plan turns into deadly game of survival
entries.description: The plan outlined by President Biden could end the war, but both sides want to get their way.

entries.title: US dog breeder fined $35m after 4,000 beagles rescued
entries.description: The fine is the largest ever issued under the US Animal Welfare Act, according to US prosecutors.

entries.title: Mexico elects Claudia Sheinbaum as first woman president
entries.description: Claudia Sheinbaum has beaten her rival, Xóchitl Gálvez, by a landslide to become Mexico's next leader.

entries.title: The ANC dilemma which will determine South Africa's future
entries.description: South Africa's leader will have to rely on the opposition to form a government after electoral losses.

entries.title: Jury seated in Hunter Biden's federal gun trial
entries.description: The jury was sworn in Monday in the first criminal trial of a child of a sitting US president.

entries.title: Russia link suspected in Eiffel Tower coffin mystery
entries.description: Officials believe Moscow could be behind a stunt in which coffins filled with plaster were left near the Eiffel Tower.

entries.title: Grass fires burn thousands of acres in California
entries.description: At least two firefighters were injured in the region's first major wildfire of the season.

entries.title: Canadian vlogger accused of sedition in Trinidad
entries.description: A popular YouTuber known for traveling to violent areas has had his passport seized by the Caribbean nation.

entries.title: Floods kill at least four in southern Germany
entries.description: Three people were trapped in basements and a firefighter died when his inflatable capsized.

entries.title: Australian army to allow recruits from four nations
entries.description: Permanent residents from countries including the UK and US will be eligible to join and get citizenship.

entries.title: Missing Cryptoqueen’s murky links to Bulgarian underworld
entries.description: The BBC investigates Ruja Ignatova’s close ties to a suspected organised crime boss.

entries.title: Imran Khan acquitted in state secrets case
entries.description: A high court acquits Khan in one case, but he will remain in prison because of another conviction.

entries.title: GameStop shares jump after investor claims stake
entries.description: Shares in the video game retailer surge after an account tied to "Roaring Kitty" claimed a large stake.

entries.title: Arrests, accusations and AI: India’s election unpacked
entries.description: On 4 June, Indians will find out who governs their country for the next five years.

entries.title: Americans react to Trump's guilty conviction
entries.description: The ex-president was found guilty on all counts of falsifying business records. Americans have mixed opinions about the verdict.

entries.title: Trump would run for president from jail, his lawyer says
entries.description: Alina Habba says Donald Trump will run for office even if he is jailed and "nothing will change" following his conviction for falsifying business records.

entries.title: ‘Aposiopesis’: Watch 12-year-old win US Spelling Bee
entries.description: Bruhat Soma correctly spelled words like ‘caixinha’ and ‘sciniph’ to take home the $50,000 prize.

entries.title: Mesmerising lava rivers as Icelandic volcano erupts
entries.description: Lava continues to spurt from from a volcanic system in Reykjanes Peninsula, after Wednesday's powerful eruption.

entries.title: District Attorney on Trump verdict: ‘I did my job’
entries.description: Alvin Bragg thanked the jury and prosecutors for their work "following the facts and the law". He said his team at the Manhattan District Attorney’s office had treated this case like they would any other, despite the defendant - a former president...

entries.title: Gazans returning to Jabalia describe 'horrifying' destruction
entries.description: Palestinians returning to the camp in northern Gaza express shock at the level of devastation they found.

entries.title: The billionaires rallying behind Trump after his conviction
entries.description: The Trump campaign has seen upticks in fundraising during pivotal moments of his legal battles.

entries.title: Volcanic thriller sparks Spielberg talks and interest from Hollywood
entries.description: Michael Crichton's widow asked bestselling author James Patterson to finish his volcanic thriller.

entries.title: 'Vote or face war': Poland PM's stark warning ahead of EU election
entries.description: Donald Tusk is urging Poles to vote for his coalition, to best protect against Russian aggression.

entries.title: Mexico's first female president breaks political glass ceiling
entries.description: Given Mexico’s deeply ingrained patriarchy and entrenched machismo, Claudia Sheinbaum's victory is no small feat.

entries.title: 'Russia now is like 1984': Inside a Russian dystopian library
entries.description: Deep in Putin's Russia, Ivanovo's George Orwell library is still lending books on totalitarianism.

entries.title: Young French leader's rise and Belgium's future existence: What to watch in EU elections
entries.description: BBC correspondents across Europe assess the national mood ahead of European Parliament elections.
